document.topic_text: CBC announcer gets Phelps, Lochte mixed up during 200m IM final The Olympics begin August 5th. Alec McQuade, WXIA 11:35 PM. EDT August 11, 2016 USA's Michael Phelps (L) and USA's Ryan Lochte celebrate on the podium after they won the Men's 4x200m Freestyle Relay Final during the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium on August 9, 2016. (Photo: MARTIN BUREAU/AFP/Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST First, let me say we all make mistakes. I just had to delete a Tweet because I forgot one word that made it horribly inaccurate. We always strive for accuracy, but when writing non-stop for about 12 hours a day, you're going to make mistakes. I'm sure the announcers at the CBC strive for accuracy, but they really messed this one up. During their broadcast of the men's 200m individual medley that featured the final showdown between Ryan Lochte and Michael Phelps, CBC announcer Elliotte Friedman got his lanes mixed up. That led to him thinking Michael Phelps was Ryan Lochte and Ryan Lochte was Michael Phelps. So in the final 50 meters of the race, Friedman was proclaiming a major upset. "Lochte is going for it...and Phelps doesn't look like he has this one in him. Lochte going to win his 13th career medal!" Meanwhile, it is really Phelps pulling away. "Ryan Lochte is going to beat Michael Phelps...Phelps might not even make the podium!" Right as Friedman said that, Phelps name came up as the winner. Oops. CBC announcer calls entire Olympic event as though Ryan Lochte is winning instead of Michael Phelps. Oh, Canada. pic.twitter.com/ldae5E4sCQ — (((Yair Rosenberg))) (@Yair_Rosenberg) August 12, 2016 I'm sorry everyone. I blew it. No excuses — Elliotte Friedman (@FriedgeHNIC) August 12, 2016 After the race, Friedman Tweeted an apology. "I'm sorry everyone. I blew it. No excuses." Except he's probably been working 20-hour days and getting little sleep. So, we'll cut him some slack. PHOTOS | Michael Phelps with Boomer Loading... Gold medalist Michael Phelps of the United States celebrates with his mother Deborah Phelps, fiancee Nicole Johnson and son Boomer during the medal ceremony for the Men's 200m Butterfly. (Photo by David Ramos/Getty Images) David Ramos, 2016 Getty Images USA's Michael Phelps (L) holds his son Boomer after he won the Men's 200m Butterfly Final during the swimming event at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium in Rio de Janeiro on August 9, 2016. / AFP / Martin BUREAU (Photo credit should read MARTIN BUREAU/AFP/Getty Images) MARTIN BUREAU, This content is subject to copyright. RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 09: The mother of Michael Phelps of the United States, Deborah Phelps, partner Nicole Johnson and their son Boomer, celebrate the gold medal victory in the Men's 200m Butterfly Final on Day 4 of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium on August 9, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Al Bello/Getty Images) Al Bello, 2016 Getty Images TOPSHOT - USA's Michael Phelps (L) holds his son Boomer after he won the Men's 200m Butterfly Final during the swimming event at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium in Rio de Janeiro on August 9, 2016. / AFP / Martin BUREAU (Photo credit should read MARTIN BUREAU/AFP/Getty Images) MARTIN BUREAU, This content is subject to copyright. USA's Michael Phelps (C) holds his son Boomer next to his mother Deborah (2ndL) and partner Nicole Johnson (R) after he won the Men's 200m Butterfly Final during the swimming event at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium in Rio de Janeiro on August 9, 2016. / AFP / CHRISTOPHE SIMON (Photo credit should read CHRISTOPHE SIMON/AFP/Getty Images) CHRISTOPHE SIMON, This content is subject to copyright. RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 09: Gold medalist Michael Phelps of the United States celebrates with his mother Deborah Phelps, fiancee Nicole Johnson and son Boomer during the medal ceremony for the Men's 200m Butterfly Final on Day 4 of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium on August 9, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Pascal Le Segretain/Getty Images) Pascal Le Segretain, 2016 Getty Images RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 09: Gold medalist Michael Phelps of the United States celebrates with his mother Deborah Phelps, fiancee Nicole Johnson and son Boomer his 20th Gold medal during the medal ceremony for the Men's 200m Butterfly Final on Day 4 of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium on August 9, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Pascal Le Segretain/Getty Images) Pascal Le Segretain, 2016 Getty Images USA's Michael Phelps (L) is congratulated by his partner Nicole Johnson, holding their son Boomer, after he won the Men's 200m Butterfly Final during the swimming event at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium in Rio de Janeiro on August 9, 2016. / AFP / Martin BUREAU (Photo credit should read MARTIN BUREAU/AFP/Getty Images) MARTIN BUREAU, This content is subject to copyright. RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 09: Gold medalist Michael Phelps of the United States celebrates with his mother Deborah Phelps, fiancee Nicole Johnson and son Boomer during the medal ceremony for the Men's 200m Butterfly Final on Day 4 of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium on August 9, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Al Bello/Getty Images) Al Bello, 2016 Getty Images TOPSHOT - USA's Michael Phelps (L) kisses his son Boomer next to his partner Nicole Johnson after he won the Men's 200m Butterfly Final during the swimming event at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium in Rio de Janeiro on August 9, 2016. / AFP / Martin BUREAU (Photo credit should read MARTIN BUREAU/AFP/Getty Images) MARTIN BUREAU, This content is subject to copyright. RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 09: Gold medalist Michael Phelps of the United States celebrates with his mother Deborah Phelps, fiancee Nicole Johnson and son Boomer during the medal ceremony for the Men's 200m Butterfly Final on Day 4 of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium on August 9, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by David Ramos/Getty Images) David Ramos, 2016 Getty Images USA's Michael Phelps (L) is congratulated by his mother Deborah (C) and partner Nicole Johnson, holding their son Boomer, after he won the Men's 200m Butterfly Final during the swimming event at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium in Rio de Janeiro on August 9, 2016. / AFP / Martin BUREAU (Photo credit should read MARTIN BUREAU/AFP/Getty Images) MARTIN BUREAU, This content is subject to copyright. Kyle Terada, Kyle Terada RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 11: Alexandra Raisman of the United States competes on the vault during the Women's Individual All Around Final on Day 6 of the 2016 Rio Olympics at Rio Olympic Arena on August 11, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Harry How/Getty Images) Harry How, 2016 Getty Images of
